results.title: Mighty Ducks 2
results.creator_credit: Sam Weisman, Jon Avnet, Jordan Kerner and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Emilio Estevez returns in another heartwarming comedy about the Mighty Ducks; an ice-hockey team full of misfit teenagers with the desire to be the best they can be. The team win an opportunity to represent their country in the Junior Goodwill Games to be held in Los Angeles. Two challenges await them - the fierce competition in the form of the team from Iceland and resisting the Hollywood glitz and glamour which threatens to tear them apart. Only team spirit will help them overcome these obstacles.

results.title: Troll in Central Park
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth, Gary Goldman, John Pomeroy, Don Bluth Productions and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Stanley is not your usual troll because he has a kind heart and a wonderful magical gift. His “green thumb” can create flowers at a touch. Wicked Queen Gnorga of the Trolls sends Stanley to New York where there is little green growing. He takes refuge in Central Park where he befriends Gus and Rosie. Unfortunately for the trio Queen Gnorga decides to spoil their fun and lets her mischief magic wreak havoc in the Big Apple. With the voices of Dom DeLuise, Cloris Leachman and Hayley Mills.

results.title: Metal skin
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Wright, Daniel Scharf, Daniel Scharf Productions and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description: After the controversial success of “Romper Stomper”, Geoffrey Wright’s second feature was a critical and commercial failure. However, this story about four young teenagers who find their only joy and exhileration in drag racing, is a mesmerising study of contemporary working class alienation. Set in Melbourne’s western suburbs the film is a hyper-kinetic study of the fractures and tensions at play in Australian society. The young cast is excellent as is the editing and cinematography.

results.title: Fried green tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe
results.creator_credit: Jordan Kerner, Jon Avnet, ACT III Communications, Electric Shadow Productions, Fried Green Tomatoes Productions and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Dowdy housewife, Evelyn Cooch meets an elderly lady, Ninny Threadgoode, who transports her back to the 1930’s by weaving a magical tale about two women, gentle Ruth, and headstrong Idgie, who ran the Whistle Stop Cafe during the Depression. Idgie’s and Ruth’s friendship defied all odds, and remained strong even when the scandal of murder threatened to seperate them. Academy Award winners Jessica Tandy and Kathy Bates play Ninny and Evelyn, while Mary-Louise Parker and Mary Stuart Masterton give excellent performances as the friends Ruth and Idgie. Based upon the novel by Fannie Flagg who also wrote the screenplay.

results.title: The Sandlot kids
results.creator_credit: David Mickey Evans, Dale de la Torre, William S. Gilmore, Island World and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Sandlot kids is a heartwarming film about friendship. Scotty Smalls is new in town and the Sandlot Kids welcome him to their gang even though he can’t play baseball. Their summer adventures playing at the sandlot and confronting the dreaded beast living behind the left field fence changes Scotty’s life forever.

results.title: The Last of the Mohicans (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Mann, Hunt Lowry and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: Daniel Day-Lewis and Madeleine Stowe star in this adaptation of James Fenimore Cooper’s classic tale of a white man raised by Mohicans and who becomes embroiled in a clash between two strong and rival nations. Set in the American colonies during the bitter Anglo-French war of 1757, Daniel Day-Lewis as Hawkeye brings strength and passion to the role. This film is typical of the epic romantic sagas with its fast action, breathtaking scenery, spectacular battle scenes and a superb cast.

results.title: The Silver brumby (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Tatoulis, Colin South and Media World Features
results.brief_description: Based on Elyne Mitchell’s famous novel, “The Silver Brumby” is set in the Australian Alps, where a rogue stallion is king of the mob of horses which roam the awesome landscape. For years, the mountain men have tried to capture him, but with no success. One horseman is determined to succeed where others have failed and embarks on an unforgettable adventure. Starring Russell Crowe, Caroline Goodall and Ami Daemion.

results.title: The Magnificent seven (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Sturges, Alpha Company and Mirisch Corporation
results.brief_description: In a stroke of filmmaking inspiration, director John Sturges saw the possibility of transposing Akira Kurosawa’s film classic “The Seven Samurai”, from feudal Japan to the American West and it worked brilliantly. Yul Brynner stars as the leader of a group of skilled gunfighters hired to protect a poor Mexican village from marauding bandits led by the vicious Calvera, played with ruthless delight by Eli Wallach. Fighting alongside Brynner and Steve McQueen are Charles Bronson, James Coburn and Robert Vaughn, whose film careers were launched by this film. With a now-classic musical score and stunning cinematography, “the Magnificent Seven” provides exciting entertainment as well as touching on the themes of dignity, honour, courage and survival. The film established a new standard for future generations of Westerns.

results.title: The Phantom of the opera
results.creator_credit: Arthur Lubin, George Waggner and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Gaston Leroux’s classic horror tale stars Claude Rains as the immortal phantom who haunts the Paris Opera. As a crazed composer, he is haunted by the beautiful soprano of the company, (Susanna Foster), and is determined to revenge himself upon those who have stolen his music. Nelson Eddy plays the heroic young baritone who tracks down the disfigured madman who has begun to murder those who resist his demands. The lavish colour production moves to a terrifying climax as the phantom is chased through the catacombs of Paris.
